text: Colorado's 28th Senate district is one of 35 districts in the Colorado Senate. It has been represented by Democrat Nancy Todd, the current President pro tempore of the Senate, since 2013. ==Geography== District 28 is based in southern Aurora, also covering parts of unincorporated Arapahoe County. The district is located entirely within Colorado's 6th congressional district, and overlaps with the 36th, 40th, 41st, 42nd, and 56th districts of the Colorado House of Representatives. ==Recent election results== Colorado Senators are elected to staggered four-year terms; under normal circumstances, the 28th district holds elections in presidential years. ===2020=== ===2016=== ===2012=== ===Federal and statewide results in District 28=== {| class=wikitable |- ! width="30" | Year ! width="60" | Office ! width="180" | Results |- | 2018 | Governor | align="right" | Polis 58.7 – 37.4% |- | 2016 | President | align="right" | Clinton 53.3 – 37.7% |- | rowspan="2" | 2014 | Senate | align="right" | Udall 49.8 – 43.8% |- | Governor | align="right" | Hickenlooper 52.5 – 42.8% |- | 2012 | President | align="right" | Obama 57.5 – 40.3% |} == References == 28 Category:Arapahoe County, Colorado
title: Colorado's 28th Senate district
